_meta.description: Universal vocabulary for DAHAO governance. All domain instances inherit these terms.

@purpose.definition: The stated goal that a DAHAO instance exists to serve. Every domain must declare its purpose.
examples: Minimize animal suffering through evidence-based ethics
Achieve climate justice for future generations
@purpose.note: Purpose is the foundation. All decisions must serve it.

@stakeholder.definition: Any entity affected by decisions within a DAHAO domain's scope.
types: indirect — affected by consequences of decisions
@stakeholder.note: Each domain defines who its stakeholders are.

@value.definition: Something the community considers worth protecting or promoting in service of its purpose.

@harm.definition: Negative impact on values the community has committed to protect.
@harm.note: Domain-specific. Animal welfare defines harm differently than AI ethics.

@protection.definition: Safeguards for stakeholders or values from harm.
@protection.ratchet: Protection is easier to add than remove. See @rule_protection_ratchet.

@proposal.definition: A formal request to modify terms, principles, or rules in a DAHAO instance.
required_fields: justification — why this change serves purpose

@consensus.definition: Collective agreement among contributors, measured by voting threshold.
@consensus.note: Thresholds can be adjusted by each domain, but cannot be lower than core defaults.

@quorum.definition: Minimum participation required for a vote to be valid.
@quorum.calculation: Percentage of active contributors (activity in last 90 days)

@vote.definition: A formal expression of position on a proposal.
types: ABSTAIN — decline to vote but count for quorum

@dialectic.definition: Structured discussion process to refine proposals through collaborative reasoning.

phases.name: thesis
phases.description: Original proposal with evidence and justification
phases.author: proposer

@evidence.definition: Documentation supporting claims in proposals or discussions.

B.name: Institutional
B.description: Reports from recognized institutions (FAO, WHO, etc.)

@version.definition: Semantic version identifier tracking changes to any DAHAO component.

@contributor.definition: Any entity participating in DAHAO governance.

@fork.definition: An independent copy of a DAHAO instance with potential modifications.
@fork.relationship: Forks maintain reference to upstream for tracking divergence.
@fork.freedom: Anyone may fork. Forks need not align with upstream.
@fork.contribution: Forks may propose changes back to upstream.

@domain.definition: A DAHAO instance focused on a specific purpose area.
requirements: May add domain-specific terms, principles, rules
